subject: Re: [junit] Need to test a method that returns void
msgSnippet: Hello Venkat, Are you using JUnit 4? If so, take a look at http://www.instrumentalservices.com/content/view/45/52/#_Expecting_exceptions Otherwise you should
messageBody:
Hello Venkat,

Are you using JUnit 4? If so, take a look at
http://www.instrumentalservices.com/content/view/45/52/#_Expecting_exceptions

Otherwise you should do something like:

try {
foo.doSomething();
fail("Exception should be raised!");
}
catch (Exception ex) {
// passed :-)
}

Regards,
--
Tiago Fernandez
http://www.tiago182.spyw.com


On 4/17/06, kotuv <kotuv@...> wrote:
>
> Need to test a method that returns 'void'. Failure of the method is by
> thorowing an exception. If no exception is thrown it is success.
>
> I have wrapped the method call in try...catch and placed
> Assert.assertTrue(false) statement in the catch block. However even
> when exception is thrown, this statement is not executed
> and 'Succeful' message is output.
>
> Help appreciated.
>
> Thanks,
> Venkat
